creditline: Gift of Jack and Linda Hoeschler, Kristen and Terry O'Brien and Jack and William O'Brien, and Frederick and Julia Hoeschler
inscription: on underside in black: John / Hoeschler / 651-699-6602 | on underside in black: Hoeschler
text:
Nakashima relied on honest hand craftsmanship, a respect for material, and simple forms. He was influenced by Japanese woodworking traditions, which he learned from a Japanese craftsman while in a Japanese-American internment camp for a year during the Second World War, and modernist architecture and design.  

His designs refer to Euro-American vernacular furniture such as simple Windsor chairs with vertical spindles. This bench with backrest is an excellent example of his adaptation of his modern Windsor chair to an asymmetrical bench. The spindled back extends only partially across the seat, leaving an extension to showcase the beautiful grain of the walnut specimen.
title: Bench with backrest
